910401D-d-04-24-91-ALQS.Narrative: THE 4 RAB CREW WITH LOCOMOTIVE 1001 WAS ENGAGED IN PULLING 22 LOADS OF STEEL COILS SOUTH ON NO.810 TRACK. WHEN THE 21ST CAR (CSXT 449148) AND 22ND CAR (CSXT 497622), NORTH OF THE LOCOMOTIVE, APPROACHED A SECTION OF RAIL, THE RAIL TURNED DUE TO A LOOSE JOINT BAR CAUSING BOTH CARS TO DERAIL. (JOINT BOLTS WERE LOOSE) THE WHEELS OF BOTH CARS RODE THE WEB OF THE RAIL FOR 23 CAR LENGTHS BEFORE THE MOVEMENT WAS STOPPED CAUSING EXTENSIVE TRACK DAMAGE. THE ENTIRE TRAIN HAD AIR IN IT AND THE CARS NEVER UNCOUPLED. THE TRACK OVER WHICH THE MOVEMENT TRAVELED IS OWNED AND MAINTAINED BY LTV STEEL CO. THE MAINTENANCE OF THIS TRACK WAS PERFORMED BY THE A&S MAINTENANCE OF WAY EMPLOYEES AT THE REQUEST OF LTV STEEL CO.NoneNoneNoneNoneNoneNoneNone

SA13-d-04-11-91-SOO.Narrative: THE TRAIN CREW REPORTED THAT THEY HAD HIT SOMETHING ON THE TRACK AND HAD STOPPED THE TRAIN. THEY THEN REPORTED THAT THE NO.3 TRACTION MOTOR ON LEAD UNIT UP 9296 WAS DAMAGED AND LEAKING FUEL. THE END RESULT WAS A LOSS OF SLIGHTLY OVER 1,700 GALLONS AND 1,600 GALLONS SAVED. UPONINSPECTION OF THE TRACK, THE SECTTION FOREMAN FOUND A 112 LB. ANGLE BAR AT MP 479.2 STUCK BETWEEN THE RAILS. THIS WAS DETERMINED TO BE THE CAUSE OF THE ACCIDENT. APPARENTLY THIS ANGLE BAR WAS ONE OVERLOOKED WHEN PICKING UPSCRAP AFTER THE 1988 RAIL RELAY. IT IS BELIEVED THAT VANDALS FOUND THE BAR AND SET IT AGAINST THE RAIL BUTTED AGAINST A TIE.NoneNoneNoneNoneNoneNoneNoneNone

NA28-d-04-19-91-SOO.Narrative: TRAIN #205 WAS SWITCHING CARS IN THE ENDERLIN YARD WHEN TWO CARS WERE DERAILED. AS THEY SHOVED EASTWARD WITH CARS FROM TRACK 3 INTO TRACK 2, BN 463503 DERAILED AS IT STRUCK AND DERAILED CP 384981 WHICH WAS SITTING ON TRACK 3. NOT REALIZING THAT THE DERAILMENT HAD OCCURRED, THE CREW DEPARTED ENDERLINWITH THEIR TRAIN. IT WAS DISCOVERED LATER BY THE ENDERLIN ROAD SWITCHER THAT WAS WORKING IN THE YARD. THE CONDUCTOR OF THAT JOB DISCOVERED THE TWO DERAILED EMPTIES. A FORMAL INVESTIGATION/HEARING WASSCHEDULED BUT CANCELLED UPON A SIGNED WAIVER FROM CONDUCTOR C.K. MYHRE, WHO ACCEPTED FULL RESPONSIBILITY FOR THE DERAILMENT DUE TO VIOLATION OF RULE 103G. A LETTER OF REPRIMAND WAS PLACED IN HIS PERSONAL FILE.NoneNoneNoneNoneNoneNoneNone

PL012-d-04-03-91-PAL.Narrative: ENGINEER AND CONDUCTOR CAME DOWN THE MAIN AT CHAROLAIS COAL CO. TO SPOT 70 EMPTY HOPPERS FOR LOADING. UPON APPROACHING THE SOUTH END OF THE COAL COMPANY THEY FOUND ABOUT 60 EMPTY HOPPERS SPOTTED FROMCHAROLAIS LOAD OUT HANGING DOWN INTO TRACK #3. THE CREW PASSED BY THE CARS AND NOTICED THAT THE SOUTH LEG WAS CLEAR AND FOULED ON THE NORTH. THE CONDUCTOR DROPPED OFF AT THE SOUTH SWITCH TO COAL YARD,REMOVED TELEMETRY AND THOUGHT THE SIDING WOULD HOLD THE 70 CAR TRAIN. THEY SHOVED INTO THE SIDE OFEMPTY HOPPERS IN #3 TRACK DERAILING THE TWO NORTH CARS OF HIS TRAIN AND TWO CARS IN #3 TRACK. FORMALINVESTIGATION BEING HELD TO DETERMINE RESPONSIBILITY.THERE WERE NO PERSONAL INJURIES AND NO DANGEROUS CARS INVOLVED.NoneNoneNoneNoneNoneNoneNone

910114-d-04-15-91-SCFE.Narrative: THE ENGINEER WAS CONTROLLING THE TRAIN WHILE SEATED AT THE CONTROLS OF LOCOMOTIVE #500. HE WAS PULLING UNDER POWER OF 250 AMPS IN #3 THROTTLE POSITION. NO AIR BRAKE WAS APPLIED. SPEED WAS RESTRICTED ON THE CURVE DUE TO EXCESSIVE SUPERELEVATION AND POOR TIE CONDITION. THE DERAILMENT OCCURRED AT A JOINT. DUE TO VERY RECENT HEAVY RAINFALL, THE GROUND AND GRADE WERE SOFT AND THE TIES WERE SPONGY. THECREW FELT A JERK AND AN EMERGENCY APPLICATION OF THE TRAIN AIR BRAKES OCCURRED. WHEN THE CREW LOOKEDBACK, THEY SAW THAT THE TWO ABOVE CARS WERE ROLLING OVER ON THEIR SIDES. THESE TWO CARS PULLED THEADJACENT TWO CARS ON EITHER END WITH THEM SO THAT THE 6TH THROUGH 11TH CARS ROLLED ONTO THEIR SIDESON THE LOW (INSIDE) OF THE CURVE. DRUG TESTING WAS PERFORMED AT HENDRY CNTY HOSPITAL UNDER REASONABLE CAUSE ITEM #1 AT 7:30PM. THIS WAS DONE BECAUSE OF THE 8 HOUR TIME LIMIT AND LACK OF KNOWLEDGE AT THE TIME OF WHAT THE DERAILMENT CAUSE WAS AND CAR DAMAGE. BOTH EMPLOYEES TESTED NEGATIVE.NoneNoneNoneNoneNone

10412BOSAA-d-04-12-91-ATK.Primary Accident Cause: Failure to apply sufficient number of hand brakes on car(s) (railroad employee)
10412BOSAA-d-04-12-91-ATK.Accident Cause: Failure to apply sufficient number of hand brakes on car(s) (railroad employee)
10412BOSAA-d-04-12-91-ATK.Narrative: AT 12 NOON AMTRAK ENGINES 587 AND 599 WITH 5 LOADED STONE CARS IN THE LEAD SHOVED NORTH ON TRACK 5 TO PICK UP 3 HOPPERS LOADED WITH STONE. THESE 3 CARS WERE COUPLED TOGETHER WITH HAND BRAKES SET ON AMTRAK 11678 AND AMTRAK 11366. AMTRAK 11591 WHICH WAS IN THE MIDDLE DID NOT HAVE BRAKES APPLIED. APPROX. 100 FEET NORTH OF THESE 3 CARS WAS AMTK 13905 WHICH WAS LOADED AND ALSO DUE TO BE ADDED TO THIS CONSIST. DUE TO RADIO CONGESTION THIS MOVE WAS BEING MADE WITH HAND SIGNALS. THE 5 LOADED STONE CARSATTACHED TO THE TWO ENGINES DID HAVE THEIR BRAKE PIPE MADE UP. ....KNUCKLES ON THE CARS WERE NOT ALIGNED WHEN CONDUCTOR SIGNAED ENGINEER TO ATTEMPT TO MAKE THE HITCH BETWEEN HIS TRAIN AND THE 3 STATIONARY CARS. WHEN THE COUPLER FAILED TO JOIN THE DRAFT OF THREE CARS WAS SENT ROLLING NORTHWARD AND STRUCK AMTK 13905 WHICH HIT THE BUMPING BLOCK ON TRACK NO.5. THIS IMPACT DERAILED THE REAR TRUCK B ENDTO THE EAST SIDE EFFECTIVELY PUTTING THE BUMPING BLOCK UP UNDER THE B END TRUCK.NARR. DESCRIPTION CONTINUED ON MULTS #2 & 3.NoneNoneNoneNone

10412PHL01-d-04-12-91-ATK.Narrative: AT 3:10AM ON APRIL 12, 1991, AN AMTRAK MOVEMENT OF LIGHT LOCOMOTIVES WAS ENROUTE NORTH, ON #2 TRACK,WHEN IT STRUCK A CONRAIL FREIGHT TRAIN, UMP22B, CROSSING GUNPOW INTERLOCKING FROM #3 TRACK TO TRACKA. THE AMTRAK ENGINES WERE FOUND TO HAVE OPERATIVE BRAKES ON ONLY THE FIRST UNIT. AMTRAK HAS DETERMINED THAT THE CAUSE OF THIS INCIDENT WAS DUE TO THE EQUIPMENT BEING IMPROPERLY MU'D (MULTIPLE UNIT),AND THAT RULES AND INSTRUCTIONS WERE NOT FOLLOWED. A TRIAL WAS HELD, WITH SUBSEQUENT DISCIPLINE OFTERMINATION ASSESSED. THIS ACCIDENT/INCIDENT IS BEING FURTHER INVESTIGATED BY THE NTSB. WHEN THEIR INVESTIGATION IS COMPLETED, AN UPDATED RAIL EQUIPMENT ACCIDENT/INCIDENT REPORT MAY BE SUBMITTED.NoneNoneNoneNoneNoneNoneNoneNone
